```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

## Data Import: CSVs

Let's import data using the `readr` package.
```{r}
litters_df = read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv")
litters_df = janitor :: clean_names(litters_df) #In the janitor package, load the clean_names function
```
Look at the data
```{r}
litters_df
head(litters_df)
tail(litters_df)
```

```{r, eval=FALSE}
view(litters_df)
```

```{r}
skimr :: skim(litters_df)
```

`read_csv` options ..
```{r, eval=FALSE}
read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv", na=c("", "NA",999,88)) #How to mark missing data
read_csv("data/FAS_litters.csv", na=c("", "NA",999,88), skip=2) # How to skip the first 2 rows

```
